In the Solo, I added a few note to the chords and open the voicing of the chords. Tried layering another piano octave higher, I lowered the volume on itâ€¦ stacking the piano instruments seems to make them sound out of phase(or something unwanted).

item.description:
@JPNYC
Ok I think I see what you mean.

@AzureOnyx
Unfortunately it was written in C#, so the best I can do is Câ€¦(changing it to a low key would require changing all the patterns down an octave as well and I cannot use pitch automation as itâ€™s already in use. Note that Iâ€™m being lazyðŸ˜‘. After I upload the revised version, if you still hear that issue, Iâ€™ll change it all to probably A flat.)

item.description:
Ok, I get will get back to you on this. As far as piano, the solo is what I was referring to. The buildup takes you to a place of height, then the piano takes you down because of the octave. So layer a higher note on topâ€¦perhaps different notes? That way you jeep that â€˜highâ€™ feeling.

item.title: Untitled - by Alyen [Ambient Trance], [WIP], [Feedback]
item.dc:creator: Alyen
item.description:
Thanks, great feedback. When you say higher notes and/or octave, are you referring only to the piano solo or the entire track?
Mastering? I would love to see what you can do with it. I should mention that I cut some of the low end off the piano(except in the solo), so that I could have that space for the other layered instrumentsâ€¦ not sure if that help or hurt.

Iâ€™m open and appreciative for anymore feedback you can offer.

item.title: Untitled - by Alyen [Ambient Trance], [WIP], [Feedback]
item.dc:creator: JPNYC
item.description:
Oh man, I really like this piece. You wouldnâ€™t know it, but I have somw chops when if comes to mastering.

A few ideas: One, I give you a ton of feedback. Two, you send me the piece and I master it with Waves plugins. If yoh have access to those plugins I can direct you.

Auxy is great for the meat of the song, buts it weak on masteringâ€¦reverb, air, bass enhancements etc.

This song is solid. The piano in the beginning feels a bit repetitious. Not your fault so much as Auxy pianos tend to sound like they were sampled from a kids toy piano. JMO

It really picks up and feels great around the 1:50 mark. When the piano solo comes in, I would like to hear some high notes, higher octave, possibly both? That would create a more uplifting sound.

The piece needs air, space, reverb to breathe. It cant accomplish that in Auxy.

I will give you more feedback if you are open.

Read full topic
